prompt: Wir haben einen Bereich pro Team. Ich möchte, dass alle Teams alle Bereiche sehen können, aber jedes Team sollte nur seinen eigenen Bereich bearbeiten können. Wie kann ich das in XWiki konfigurieren?
expected_answer:
Um die gewünschte Zugriffssteuerung zu erreichen, können Sie die folgenden Schritte ausführen:

1. **Erstellen Sie Gruppen für jedes Team**: Erstellen Sie eine separate Gruppe für jedes Team in Ihrer XWiki-Instanz. Dies ermöglicht es Ihnen, die Zugriffsrechte für jedes Team individuell zu verwalten.
2. **Einstellen von wikiweiten Rechten**: Gehen Sie zur Wiki-Administrationsseite und stellen Sie die Rechte für das gesamte Wiki ein. Stellen Sie insbesondere das "View"-Recht auf "Allow" für "XWikiAllGroup" ein, um allen das Anzeigen aller Bereiche zu ermöglichen.
3. **Einstellen von Bereichebene Rechte**: Für jeden Teambereich gehen Sie zur Bereichverwaltungsseite und stellen Sie die Rechte für diesen Bereich ein. Stellen Sie insbesondere das "Edit"-Recht auf "Allow" nur für die entsprechende Teamgruppe ein. Dies ermöglicht es nur den Mitgliedern dieses Teams, ihren eigenen Bereich zu bearbeiten.
4. **Vererben von Rechten für untergeordnete Seiten**: Wenn Sie Rechte für einen Bereich festlegen, stellen Sie sicher, dass Sie die Option "Rights: Page & Children" auswählen, um die Rechte für alle untergeordneten Seiten innerhalb dieses Bereichs zu vererben.

Durch die Ausführung dieser Schritte stellen Sie sicher, dass:

* Alle Teams alle Bereiche sehen können.
* Jedes Team nur seinen eigenen Bereich bearbeiten kann.

Erinnern Sie sich daran, die Rechte entsprechend für alle zusätzlichen Teams oder Bereiche anzupassen, die Sie in Ihrer XWiki-Instanz haben.

sources.content:
Additionally, the following actions may be performed:

* Create children pages
* Change page access rights
* Edit the page's objects and classes (this is an advanced use case that you'll learn later on)
* Rename, copy and delete the page.

# Wiki

When you start you are on the main wiki. However it's possible to create other wiki (a.k.a subwikis). A wiki is a collection of wiki pages.

This can be useful if you wish to have some clean separation between different types of content (for more details, see the [Content Organization page](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/ContentOrganization/)).

You can create as many wikis as you want and as many pages as you want in every wiki.

Usually you start with a single wiki since that's the simplest from an organization point of view and then when the need outgrows this wiki, you can refactor the content over several wikis.

# Panels

A panel is a widget you can see on every page of your wiki in the standard version of XWiki. Panels are displayed within columns. By default you will see an Applications and Navigation panels on the left and some other secondary panels on the right.

You can control panels in multiple ways:

* Choose which columns to display (right column, left column, both columns, none)
* Choose the width of the columns to display (small, medium, large)
* Choose which panels to put in your side columns

Panels are useful for building menus or adding features to your pages. You can set different panels for each space in your wiki. Step to the next section to find out more about modifying your wiki's columns and panels.

**Next: [First steps with XWiki](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/GettingStarted/FirstStepsWithXWiki)**

| id | Id | Navigation | Allows putting a reference/location in a page. In HTML for example this is called an Anchor. It allows pointing to that location, for example in links. | Global |
| [image](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Macros/ImageMacro) | Image | content | Displays an image in a box | Global |
| [imagePres](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/DevGuide/Scripting/XWikiVelocityTraining/XWikiVelocityTrainingImageMacro) | imagePres |  |  | Current Wiki |
| include | Include | Content | Include other pages into the current page. | Global |
| info | Info Message | Formatting | Displays an info message note. | Global |
| jira | JIRA | Content | Fetches information from a JIRA server and displays them as a table, list or enumeration. | Global |
| [language](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Macros/Language) | Language |  | List the flag and name for a given list of languages | Global |
| [latestBlogPosts](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWikiOrgCode/LatestBlogPosts) | Latest Blog Posts |  | Shows the latest blog posts articles | Global |
| liveData | Live Data | Content | Display dynamic lists of data. | Global |
| [mention](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Mentions/MentionsMacro) | User Mention | Notifications | Insert a user mention. | Current Wiki |
| [menu](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Menu/MenuMacro) | Menu | Navigation | Displays a menu created using simple wiki syntax (nested lists and links). | Global |
| [messageSender](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/MessageSenderMacro) | Message Sender | Social | A control that allows users to enter messages that are handled by the MessageStream module. | Current Wiki |
| missingLicenseMessage | Missing License Message |  | Display an error message when the extension does not have a valid license. | Global |

XWiki Syntax 2.0
XWiki Syntax 2.1




XWiki Syntax 2.1

## XWiki Syntax 2.1: All

* [General](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/XWikiSyntax/?syntax=2.1&category=0)
	+ [Introduction](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/XWikiSyntax/?syntax=2.1&section=Introduction)
	+ [General Remarks](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/XWikiSyntax/?syntax=2.1&section=GeneralRemarks)
	+ [Other Syntaxes](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/XWikiSyntax/?syntax=2.1&section=OtherSyntaxes)
* [Editing](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/XWikiSyntax/?syntax=2.1&category=1)
	+ [Paragraphs](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/XWikiSyntax/?syntax=2.1&section=Paragraphs)
	+ [Headings](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/XWikiSyntax/?syntax=2.1&section=Headings)
	+ [Text Formatting](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/XWikiSyntax/?syntax=2.1&section=TextFormatting)
	+ [Horizontal Line](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/XWikiSyntax/?syntax=2.1&section=HorizontalLine)
	+ [Lists](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/XWikiSyntax/?syntax=2.1&section=Lists)
	+ [Definition Lists](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/XWikiSyntax/?syntax=2.1&section=DefinitionLists)
	+ [New Line/Line Breaks](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/XWikiSyntax/?syntax=2.1&section=NewLineLineBreaks)
	+ [Links](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/XWikiSyntax/?syntax=2.1&section=Links)
	+ [Tables](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/XWikiSyntax/?syntax=2.1&section=Tables)

You can also browse through the hundreds of [Applications](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/) (and more generally Extensions) developed on top of XWiki. They can be installed in your wiki using the [Extension Manager](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Extension%20Manager%20Application).

 Once you've mastered it and if you wish to go further, check the [Programming features](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Programming), followed by the [Developer's Guide](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/DevGuide/).





#### Did you know?



 Chris Anderson introduced the concept of [Long Tail](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Long_tail). 
[![xwikilongtail.png](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/SecondGenerationWiki/WebHome/xwikilongtail.png?rev=1.7)](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/SecondGenerationWiki/WebHome/xwikilongtail.png?rev=1.7)
 Applying it to XWiki gives the above diagram.
 

 What it means is that there are thousands and thousands of applications required by users that are **not** built today because of prohibitive *complexity* and *costs* (the yellow area is larger than the red area on the diagram).


They would also take too long to build and their value would decrease as more and more time passes for their implementation.


They need to be created here and now to have the highest possible value. 


XWiki is a cost-effective solution that allows non-developers to create those required applications quickly and in an organic manner.

**Contents*** [Preferences](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/I18N#HPreferences)
* [Switch to another language](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/I18N#HSwitchtoanotherlanguage)
* [Page translations](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/I18N#HPagetranslations)
* [Edit a translation](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/I18N#HEditatranslation)
XWiki can be set-up to support one or various languages.
